snippet: The Vatican computer expert accused of aiding and abetting the theft of the pope’s confidential papers began his trial on Monday.
abstract: Lawyer for Claudio Sciarpelletti, Vatican computer expert accused of helping Paolo Gabriele, Pope Benedict XVI's former butler, to steal confidential papers, argues his client had no reason to risk his career to help Gabriele because he did not know him well; statement is made in opening hearing of second trial related to security breach at Vatican.
lead_paragraph: The Vatican computer expert accused of aiding and abetting the theft of the pope’s confidential papers began his trial on Monday.

headline.seo: The Vatican: Leaks Trial, Part II
headline.main: The Vatican: Leaks Trial, Part II
headline.print_headline: The Vatican: Leaks Trial, Part II
